name: serve
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: Do they serve meals in the bar?
example.egtrans: 这家酒吧提供饭菜吗？

example.eg: Breakfast is served in the restaurant between 7.00 and 11.00.
example.egtrans: 餐馆早上7点到11点供应早餐。

example.eg: We arrived at the hotel and were served with champagne and canapés.
example.egtrans: 我们到达宾馆后，宾馆提供了香槟和小吃。

example.eg: All recipes in this book, unless otherwise stated, will serve (= be enough for) four to five people.
example.egtrans: 本书里的所有食谱，除了特别标明的，都可供4至5人享用。

example.eg: Serve the pie warm with ice cream or whipped cream.
example.egtrans: 趁热上果馅糕点，配上冰淇凌或掼奶油。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to work for; to do your duty to

example.eg: He served in the army for 22 years.
example.egtrans: 他服了22年兵役。

example.eg: She has served on the committee for the last 15 years.
example.egtrans: 15年来，她一直在该委员会任职。

example.eg: He served under Ronald Reagan as Secretary of State.
example.egtrans: 他在罗纳德‧里根手下担任国务卿。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to help achieve something or to be useful as something

example.eg: An official investigation would not serve any useful purpose.
example.egtrans: 正式调查不会达到什么有益的成效。

example.eg: The judge said that the fine would serve as a warning to other drivers.
example.egtrans: 法官说此次罚款对其他司机会是一种警告。

example.eg: In the absence of anything better the settee could serve as a bed for a couple of nights.
example.egtrans: 如果没有更好的选择，长沙发可以当几天床用。

example.eg: Nothing serves to explain the violent fighting we have seen recently.
example.egtrans: 什么都无法解释我们最近所目睹的暴力斗殴。

example.eg: My umbrella will serve for a weapon.
example.egtrans: 我的伞可以当武器用。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide with something that is needed

example.eg: The report says the police are out of touch with the communities that they serve.
example.egtrans: 这份报告指出，警方对他们所服务的社区毫不了解。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a shop, restaurant, or hotel, to deal with a customer by taking their order, showing or selling them goods, etc.

example.eg: Are you being served, madam?
example.egtrans: 女士，有服务员招待您吗？

example.eg: Have you been served, ma'am?
example.egtrans: 女士，有服务员招待过您了吗？

example.eg: That's the restaurant where they refused to serve John because he was so rude.
example.egtrans: 就是那家餐馆拒绝接待约翰，因为他太粗鲁。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spend a period of time doing something

example.eg: He served four years in prison for robbery.
example.egtrans: 他因抢劫坐了4年牢。

example.eg: After he'd served his apprenticeship he set up his own business.
example.egtrans: 他学徒期满后自立门户。

example.eg: He's serving time for drug offences.
example.egtrans: 他因毒品犯罪正在服刑。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports such as tennis, to hit the ball to the other player as a way of starting the game

example.eg: Whose turn is it to serve?
example.egtrans: 轮到谁发球了？

example.eg: That's the third ace you've served this game.
example.egtrans: 那是你在这局比赛中第3次发球得分。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give a legal document to someone, demanding that they go to a law court or that they obey an order

example.eg: Less than two weeks ago Gough finally served a writ on Slater, claiming damages for alleged loss of royalties.
example.egtrans: 不到两个星期以前，高夫终于将传票送达给斯莱特，要求对其所涉及的版税损失作出赔偿。

example.eg: Each person served with a summons will be given six weeks before they have to appear in the Magistrates' Court.
example.egtrans: 每一个收到传票的人在地方法院出庭之前都有6个星期的时间。

name: serve
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports such as tennis, the act of hitting the ball to the other player to start play

example.eg: It's your serve.
example.egtrans: 该你发球了。

example.eg: Murray broke Federer's serve (= he won a game in which Federer hit the ball first).
example.egtrans: 穆雷破了费德勒的发球局。
